level.text: The rules of procedure in this section shall apply to rulemaking proceedings, including petitions for amendments to the text of the Zoning Regulations pursuant to § 102 and to certain applications for a change in the Zoning Maps of the District designated by the Commission pursuant to § 3010.7 as coming within the Commission’s rulemaking power.
The rules in this section shall supplement the rules in §§ 3010, 3011, 3013, 3014, 3015, 3020, and 3024.

Any person may appear at a hearing in a rulemaking proceeding, and may present, within the time limits determined by the Commission, evidence, testimony, or argument that is relevant and not unduly repetitious.
No person shall have the standing of a party in a rulemaking proceeding.
The order of procedure at the hearing shall be as follows:
Call to order and opening statement by the presiding officer;
Consideration of pending motions and procedural matters;
Reports or statements by the Office of Planning and other public agency representatives;
Persons in support of the application or petition; and
Persons in opposition to the application or petition.
